intro: Cicerbita kovalevskiana, commonly known as the Kovalevskaya bittercress, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It thrives in rocky or arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
